summary: The Book of Kells is an ancient, beautifully decorated book from around 800 AD. It contains the four Gospels of the New Testament and was made by monks in Ireland or Scotland. The book is famous for its stunning artwork, featuring colorful Celtic designs, animals, and mythical creatures. Each page is carefully crafted with intricate details, making it a masterpiece of medieval art. Today, you can see it at Trinity College in Dublin, where they display two pages at a time, changing them every few weeks. You can also explore it online.
title: Book of Kells
